src:
Neverjetno: SDS se je povezala z Levico
04 Nov 2019, 06:05 by Alenka Penjak

V piranskem občinskem svetu je nastala nova politična koalicija. Pozornost vzbuja predvsem zato, ker sta v njej predstavnika strank iz skrajnih političnih polov, Levice in SDS, koordinator koalicije pa je član SMC.



Z leve: Savo Radić (neodvisni), Vojko Jevševar (SDS) in Barbara Kožar (Levica) Foto: Arhiv PN

PIRAN > Na zadnji seji piranskega občinskega sveta je Barbara Kožar iz Levice pojasnila, da se je njena stranka povezala v enotno svetniško skupino skupaj s SDS, ki jo zastopa Vojko Jevševar, in z neodvisnim svetnikom Savom Radićem. Ta je v občinski svet stopil kot član stranke Slovenija za vedno, ki je ena od političnih grupacij, ki jih obvladuje nekdanji koprski župan Boris Popovič. Radić je Slovenijo za vedno zapustil po glasovanju o občinskem proračunu, ki ga je podprl, stranka pa je imela nasprotno mnenje.
“Občinska uprava potrebuje pomoč”
“V neodvisni svetniški skupini bomo v prihodnje sodelovali in enotno glasovali. Ko si to zasluži, občinska uprava potrebuje pomoč, in mi bomo z njo konstruktivno sodelovali,” je pojasnila Kožarjeva. Iz tega je razumeti, da bodo podpirali projekte piranskega župana Đenia Zadkovića. V prvem letu tega mandata je bila omenjena trojica neopredeljena: občasno je podpirala Zadkovićeve predloge, včasih pa je glasovala tudi v sozvočju z GZOP in županovimi nasprotniki.
Napovedali so, da je njihov koordinator AndrejKorenika, predsednik lokalnega odbora SMC in nekdanji občinski svetnik ter županski kandidat, ki je dandanes tudi član nadzornega odbora občine. Na naše vprašanje, zakaj je začel združevati piranske občinske svetnike, pravi, da ga zanima napredek občine.
Do Zadkovića kritični, a ga ne želijo rušiti
“Združili so se na moj predlog, saj si želimo, da bi projekte, ki so občini v korist, izpeljali še v tem županskem mandatu. Naš cilj ni rušenje župana Đenia Zadkovića, čeprav smo do njega kritični in menimo, da je požrl svoje predvolilne obljube. Ne želimo preostalih treh let njegovega mandata vreči v smeti. V našem interesu je, da se vsi premaknemo z mrtve točke,” je za naš časnik pojasnil Andrej Korenika. Dodaja, da so v enotno svetniško skupino vabljeni tudi ostali občinski svetniki.
Na lokalni ravni pogosto nastanejo koalicije, ki so v nasprotju z državno ravnjo in se zdijo z ideološkega vidika povsem nelogične, na primer koalicije med SD in SDS oziroma NSi. Kljub temu se v Sloveniji po naših podatkih še ni zgodilo, da bi v koaliciji skupaj pristali SDS kot desnosredinska stranka in radikalno leva Levica. Da jima ob tem asistira še sredinska in izpričano liberalna SMC, pa še dodatno zavozla zadevo.
text:
Incredible: SDS hooked up with Left
04 Nov 2019, 06:05 by Alenka Penjak

A new political coalition has emerged in the Piran Municipal Council. It draws attention to the fact that it is represented by parties from extreme political parties, the Left and the SDS, and the coalition coordinator is a member of the SMC.



From left: Savo Radic (Independent), Vojko Jevsevar (SDS) and Barbara Kozar (Left) Photo: PN Archive

PIRAN> At the last session of the Piran Municipal Council, Barbara Kozar from Levica explained that her party had joined a unified council group together with the SDS, represented by Vojko Jevševar, and with independent councilor Sava Radic. He joined the municipal council as a member of the party Slovenia forever, which is one of the political groups controlled by the former mayor of Koper, Boris Popovic. Radic left Slovenia forever after voting on the municipal budget, which he supported, and the party had the opposite opinion.
“The municipal administration needs help”
“We will continue to work together and vote unanimously in an independent council group. When it deserves it, the municipal administration needs help, and we will cooperate constructively with it, ”explained Kozar. From this it is understood that they will support the projects of the Mayor of Piran, Đeni Zadković. In the first year of that term, the three were undecided: occasionally supporting Zadkovic's proposals, but sometimes voting in unison with the GZOP and the mayor's opponents.
They announced that their coordinator was AndrejKorenika, chairman of the SMC Local Board and a former municipal councilor and mayor candidate, who is also a member of the municipality's supervisory board today. Asked why he started bringing together Piran municipal councilors, he says he is interested in the municipality's progress.
They are critical of Zadkovic but do not want to ruin him
“They have united on my proposal, as we would like to see projects that benefit the municipality continue in this mayoral term. Our goal is not to overthrow Mayor Đeni Zadković, although we are critical of him and believe that he has kept his election promises. We do not want to throw the remaining three years of his term in the trash. It is in our interest that we all move from the blind spot, ”Andrej Korenika explained to our newspaper. He adds that other municipal councilors are also invited to join the single council group.
At the local level, coalitions are often created that are at odds with the national level and seem ideologically completely illogical, such as coalitions between the SD and SDS, or the NSi. Nevertheless, according to our data, it has not yet happened in the coalition that the SDS as a center-right party and a radical left-wing party together would land. The fact that they were assisted by the middle and apologetically liberal SMC further complicated the matter.
